Running a headless execution fails with java.lang.NullPointerException.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
at
org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.launchTest(TestExecutionHarness.java)
	at
org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.launchTest(TestExecutionHarness.java)
at
org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.main(TestExecutionHarness.java)

This defect was found while running org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.tests
verifying fix for  defect 72311.  This manual test requires you to run a
headless execution.

The problem is with OSGI dependency. In class TextExecutionHarness 
constructor, an OSGI class is tempted to be loaded, if successful, it's used 
as a indication of running inside the workbench. 

Class.forName(TestExecutionHarness.STANDALONE_INDICATOR_CLASS);

In case of standalone execution, osgi is not expected to be on the classpath 
so the loading will fail and everything will work as standalone from this 
point on. In the private launchTest() method, 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.Job is used which depends on osgi and thus will 
fail.
		
Job monitor = new Job(executionResultName)
*** Bug 95067 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Standalone mode is now prepared correctly.

The standalone indicator class is now not used -- instead the 
Platform.getProduct() method is invoked and the result is compared to null.  
If the result is null then the harness is being run in standalone mode, if non-
null it is being run within a product in non-standalone mode.

Standalone mode will be replaced by headless mode in the near future (4.1+) 
for test execution and this will have to be re-examined at that time and 
deprecated to make way for the recommended approach for launching tests 
outside of the IDE.
